title: Russia Jails 3 More Captive Ukrainian Troops
description: Rights groups have criticized Moscow for holding trials against captured Ukrainian soldiers, which have taken place in occupied Ukrainian territory or in Russia itself.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Wagner Resumes Recruitment Under New Leadership – Reports
description: The private military company has reportedly started to recruit fighters as part of Russia's National Guard in the Perm and Novosibirsk regions.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Bulgaria Expels Russian State Media Correspondent
description: Journalist Aleksander Gatsak had been found to be performing "activity that poses a threat to Bulgaria's national security," authorities in Sofia said.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Russian State Duma Lawmakers Stripped of Mandates
description: Deputies Vasily Vlasov and Vadim Belousov were formally dismissed from Russia's lower-house State Duma for skipping committee meetings for more than a month.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Russia’s Muslims Dismayed By Anti-Israeli Airport Riot
description: “Islamophobia exists both in Russia and abroad and this will change attitudes towards us,” a Dagestan-born human rights lawyer said.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Pussy Riot Decries Russian Wartime Propaganda in New Music Video
description: The anti-Kremlin group's latest music video exudes the atmosphere of dark Slavic folktales — used to show the world through the eyes of children in wartime Russia.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Russian Courts Sentence 15 Over Anti-Israeli Airport Riot
description: Courts in Dagestan have sentenced at least 15 people to between two and ten days in prison for their involvement in Sunday night's riot.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Volcano in Russia's Far East Spews Huge Ash Plume Into Atmosphere
description: The Klyuchevskaya volcano, one of the world's most active volcanoes, began erupting in late June
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Exiled Navalny Aide’s Father Released From Prison
description: Navalny aide Ivan Zhdanov has linked his elderly father Yury’s imprisonment to his own political activities.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: N. Korea Sends Russia Artillery Rounds for Satellite Technical Advice – Seoul
description: In return for the arms shipments, North Korea appears to have received technical advice from Moscow as it attempts to launch a military reconnaissance satellite.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Crimea Targeted by ‘Large Number’ of Aerial Weapons
description: Kremlin-installed authorities in the annexed peninsula did not specify what types of weapons were used against Crimea or their intended targets.

album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Putin Replaces Vologda Governor Ahead of 2024 Elections
description: Oleg Kuvshinnikov had served as the Vologda region's Governor since 2011 before Tuesday's reshuffle.

title: Ukraine Reports Broadest Russian Shelling Attack This Year
description: More than 100 settlements were targeted in the attack, Ukraine's interior minister said.

album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Three Russians Arrested in New York for Shipping Arms Components
description: The trio is accused of evading sanctions by sending "over 300 shipments of restricted items, valued at approximately $10 million, to the Russian battlefield."

title: Russia Denies Russian-American Journalist's Appeal Against Detention
description: Kurmasheva is the second U.S. journalist to be arrested in Russia this year after Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich was detained in March.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
